channel.title: Defense
channel.description: News, Analysis and Opinion from POLITICO

item.title: Senate pushes forward with boat strike probe as House pulls back
item.description: Senate Armed Services Committee Chair Roger Wicker said he would “listen to his colleagues.”

media:content.media:title: Adm. Frank M. Bradley, right, accompanied by Gen. Dan Caine, chair of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, walks to a meeting with senators on Capitol Hill on Dec. 4, 2025.

item.dc:creator: By Joe Gould and Leo Shane III
item.dc:contributor: By Joe Gould and Leo Shane III

item.title: House passes defense bill, forcing Pentagon's hand on boat strike videos
item.description: The must-pass legislation also restricts the Trump administration from significantly reducing U.S. troop levels in Europe

media:content.media:title: House Armed Services Chair Mike Rogers (R-Ala.) and ranking member Adam Smith (D-Wash.) will mark up the chamber's fiscal 2026 National Defense Authorization Act this week.

item.dc:creator: By Connor O'Brien
item.dc:contributor: By Connor O'Brien

item.title: Trump lacks support or logistics for Venezuela ground invasion
item.description: The president told POLITICO on Monday that he wouldn’t rule out a ground invasion of the South American country.

media:content.media:title: Supporters of Venezuela’s President Nicolas Maduro wave Venezuelan flags in Caracas on Aug. 11.

item.dc:creator: By Paul McLeary, Jack Detsch and Joe Gould
item.dc:contributor: By Paul McLeary, Jack Detsch and Joe Gould

item.title: Johnson quietly cut provisions about Afghan relocation from NDAA
item.description: Republicans are facing intense pressure to clamp down on any programs that benefit Afghan refugees in the wake of the Nov. 26 shooting of two West Virginia National Guard members.

media:content.media:title: The provisions to restore the State Department’s Office of the Coordinator for Afghan Relocation Efforts said that language reestablishing the office was included in the draft compromise NDAA as recently as Friday. Then Mike Johnson and Republican leadership axed it over the weekend.

item.dc:creator: By Eric Bazail-Eimil
item.dc:contributor: By Eric Bazail-Eimil

item.title: Congress to withhold Pentagon travel funds until it sees boat strike videos
item.description: Lawmakers quietly stuck the requirement into their must-pass annual defense policy bill.

media:content.media:title: President Donald Trump speaks during a Cabinet meeting at the White House on Dec. 2, 2025, in Washington, as Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth looks on.

item.dc:creator: By Leo Shane III, Connor O'Brien and Joe Gould
item.dc:contributor: By Leo Shane III, Connor O'Brien and Joe Gould

item.title: Compromise defense bill stymies Trump on Europe troop withdrawals
item.description: The National Defense Authorization Act also would repeal a pair of decades-old war authorizations and proposes an $8 billion boost to Trump's defense budget.

media:content.media:title: Speaker Mike Johnson and House Armed Services Chair Mike Rogers will aim to pass the final version of the National Defense Authotization Act this week.

item.dc:creator: By Connor O'Brien
item.dc:contributor: By Connor O'Brien

item.title: Hegseth declares end of US 'utopian idealism' with new military strategy
item.description: The Defense secretary, speaking at the Reagan Defense Forum, outlined defense priorities that focus on the Western Hemisphere and reevaluate the U.S. relationship with Europe.

media:content.media:title: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth speaks to senior military leaders at Marine Corps Base Quantico on Sept. 30, 2025, in Quantico, Virginia.

item.dc:creator: By Paul McLeary
item.dc:contributor: By Paul McLeary

item.title: Read the Signalgate report
item.description: The Pentagon inspector general investigated whether Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated the agency’s standards for sharing classified information and put troops in danger.

item.title: Top 6 takeaways from the Pentagon’s Signalgate investigation
item.description: The agency watchdog investigated whether the Defense secretary violated the agency’s standards for sharing classified information and put troops in danger.

item.title: New York Times sues Pentagon over press restrictions
item.description: The world-famous newspaper is suing Pete Hegseth and the Defense Department to reverse the new press policy.

media:content.media:title: The lawsuit lists Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth and a top Pentagon spokesperson as co-defendants.

item.dc:creator: By Gregory Svirnovskiy
item.dc:contributor: By Gregory Svirnovskiy

item.title: Can Hegseth’s MAGA playbook spare him again?
item.description: The Defense secretary has a game plan for controversies, but the latest ones may prove a stiffer test.

media:content.media:title: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth speaks during a Cabinet meeting, Dec. 2, 2025, in Washington.

item.dc:creator: By Jack Detsch

item.title: China debate delayed Trump security strategy
item.description: Two key documents laying out the administration's strategic national security priorities are now expected to be released this month.

media:content.media:title: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent speaks during an event on "Trump Accounts" for kids in the Roosevelt Room of the White House, Dec. 2, 2025, in Washington.

item.dc:creator: By Paul McLeary and Nahal Toosi
item.dc:contributor: By Paul McLeary and Nahal Toosi

item.title: Pentagon watchdog says Hegseth’s Signal chats put troops at risk
item.description: The inspector general produced two reports on the Defense secretary’s use of the messaging app to discuss sensitive Yemen strike plans.

media:content.media:title: The reports conclude a nine-month investigation into whether Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated the Pentagon's standards for sharing classified information and endangered troops.

item.dc:creator: By Joe Gould and Maggie Miller
item.dc:contributor: By Joe Gould and Maggie Miller

item.title: Second boat strike tests GOP loyalty to Trump
item.description: More Republicans are showing alarm about the president's military campaign against alleged drug traffickers in the Caribbean.

item.title: White House says admiral approved second deadly boat strike
item.description: Karoline Leavitt defended the killings — and seemed to deflect any blame away from Pete Hegseth.

media:content.media:title: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth speaks after a meeting with Dominican Republic President Luis Abinader in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic, on Nov. 26.

item.title: Allies worry US demands Ukraine deal before security guarantees
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio told European allies that President Donald Trump will negotiate long-term assurances for Ukraine’s safety.

media:content.media:title: Secretary of State Marco Rubio sits during negotiations with Ukrainians over a peace plan in Geneva on Nov. 23.

item.dc:contributor: By Paul McLeary and Jack Detsch

item.title: Pete Hegseth is a no-show in Ukraine. That suits the White House just fine.
item.description: The Defense secretary has carved out an unorthodox political niche that has helped insulate him from criticism inside the administration, at least for now.

media:content.media:title: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth arrives at the White House to watch President Donald Trump pardon a Turkey on Nov. 25.

item.title: Driscoll meets with Russians in Abu Dhabi about Ukraine peace plan
item.description: The Army secretary is speaking to Russian officials on Tuesday without Secretary of State Marco Rubio or other U.S. negotiators.

media:content.media:title: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy shakes hands with Army Secretary Dan Driscoll in Kyiv, Ukraine, Nov. 20, 2025.

item.title: Pentagon to investigate Sen. Mark Kelly for anti-Trump video
item.description: The unprecedented move comes after the retired Navy captain advised troops they don’t need to obey unlawful orders.

media:content.media:title: Sen. Mark Kelly (D-Ariz.) speaks with reporters outside a bipartisan Senate luncheon on Capitol Hill on Oct. 23, 2025.

item.title: Lawmakers say Rubio distanced US from peace plan
item.description: Members of Congress attending an international security forum said Secretary of State Marco Rubio called them to say the Americans did not instigate the proposal.

media:content.media:title: Sen. Mike Rounds (R-S.D.) speaks with reporters as he arrives for a Senate Republican Conference meeting at the U.S. Capitol on the 38th day of a government shutdown, Nov. 7, 2025.

item.title: Ukraine's allies consider how to fill intelligence gaps if US backs out
item.description: Trump’s threat to withhold military intelligence exposes lagging satellite abilities among allies.

media:content.media:title: A dead body lies on the ground at a market destroyed by a Russian airstrike on Zaporizhzhia, Ukraine, Friday, Nov. 21, 2025.

item.title: GOP lawmaker complains Canada’s defense spending still falls short in the long run
item.description: Ottawa defends NATO commitment as forward progress at 'breakneck' speed

item.title: US and Russia to meet about Ukraine as Europe races to influence deal
item.description: Army Secretary Dan Driscoll told a group of European ambassadors that the continent couldn’t match the Russian defense industry’s output, and the time for settling had arrived.

media:content.media:credit: Ukrainian Presidential Press Office via AP
media:content.media:title: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy talks with Army Secretary Dan Driscoll in Kyiv, Ukraine on Nov. 20, 2025.

item.title: A Vance ally rises at the Pentagon — with Trump's blessing
item.description: Dan Driscoll’s visit to Ukraine this week underscored his new prominence in the administration.

media:content.media:credit: Ukrainian Presidential Press Office via AP
media:content.media:title: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy shakes hands with U.S. Army Secretary Dan Driscoll in Kyiv, Ukraine on Nov. 20, 2025.

item.title: Top Army officials visit Kyiv on peace and tech sharing mission
item.description: It's the highest-level visit by the Trump administration to the war-torn country since Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent traveled to Kyiv in February.

media:content.media:title: Army Secretary Dan Driscoll (above) and chief of staff Gen. Randy George have used Ukrainian battlefield innovations as an example the U.S. defense industry and Pentagon should emulate in weapons development.

item.dc:creator: By Paul McLeary and Jack Detsch
item.dc:contributor: By Paul McLeary and Jack Detsch

item.title: Trump says he will sell F-35s to Saudi Arabia
item.description: The president's comments, which could antagonize Israel, come a day before he welcomes Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to the White House.

media:content.media:title: President Donald Trump arrives with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman for a group photo with Gulf Cooperation Council leaders during the GCC Summit in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia on May 14, 2025.

item.dc:creator: By Eli Stokols, Paul McLeary, Jack Detsch and Felicia Schwartz
item.dc:contributor: By Eli Stokols, Paul McLeary, Jack Detsch and Felicia Schwartz

item.title: Republicans turn on Trump’s defense policy chief
item.description: Administration allies say they are fed up with the Defense Department’s third-most senior leader and his foreign policy surprises.

media:content.media:title: Elbridge Colby, nominee to be undersecretary of Defense for policy, arrives for a hearing of the Senate Armed Services Committee at the U.S. Capitol in Washington on March 4, 2025.

item.dc:contributor: By Joe Gould, Connor O'Brien and Paul McLeary

item.title: Hegseth, in tone shift, talks nice to defense industry
item.description: The Pentagon chief offered a rare message of unity in a Friday speech to executives.

media:content.media:title: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth salutes as he and South Korean Defense Minister Ahn Gyu-back inspect a guard of honor in Seoul, South Korea, on Nov. 4.

item.dc:contributor: By Paul McLeary, Jack Detsch and Joe Gould

item.title: Trump nominates Isaacman to run NASA — again
item.description: The unprecedented move follows a high-profile fight over who will run the space agency.

media:content.media:title: Jared Isaacman, U.S. President Donald Trump's nominee to be NASA administrator, testifies during a Senate Commerce, Science, and Transportation Committee confirmation hearing in the Russell Senate Office Building on Capitol Hill on April 9, 2025, in Washington.

item.dc:creator: By Audrey Decker
item.dc:contributor: By Audrey Decker

item.title: Canada, in push away from US, aims to invest billions in defense
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s budget, released Tuesday, calls for a new industrial strategy and a multibillion-dollar project to bolster Ottawa’s defense spending.

media:content.media:title: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is flanked by Chief of the Defence Staff Gen. Carignan, left, and Minister of National Defence, David McGuinty, as they attend a tour of the Fort York Armoury in Toronto on June 9, 2025.

item.dc:creator: By Paul McLeary
